column5: Just looked at the long range forecast for Southwestern Ontario and even though right now 9:06 PM it's -12C ( 4F ) according to the predictions the cold spell will end starting tomorrow with temps above freezing.  Suppose to be like this for a week or so with possible rain mixed in.  If true be careful all you ice fishermen and watch for changing conditions.
Thanks fer the heads up, Gary. A welcome change fer some.
The Weather Network is showing +8C next Sunday in Toronto. Hope they are right!

WOOOOOOOOHHHHOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Its about darn time it warmed up around here, I cant stand this weather!  Soon enough ill be standin at the side of my favourite trib fishing for steel!
The bad part of this "news" is that it's showing Freezing rain for Saturday and that will be no fun what so ever for the Tyler G2G !
They are calling for a warm up this week here too, LOL good thing I have 4 or 5 foot snow drifts. Hope it doesn`t melt to fast though.

Just another little note of caution guys ... and this is VERY serious ... I was out on Lk Joseph this weekend and while there was proabably 12 inches of ice .. at least 7 of this was 'bad' ice ... if any moisture at all gets into it, it COMPLETELY loses its integrity very quickly so please do NOT go on the basis of the ice you saw last weekend
Were heading up to Ottawa to do the tourist thing next weekend, so sunny & mild would suit us just fine, although I don't know if Ottawa has ever been mild in February, has it
I dont think it'll be the LAST cold night, but I'm really hoping it is!!! At any rate, overall the temps will begin to rise again....PHEW!!!!
Hey fellas I was just wondering with these warm temps coming, how long do you guys wait after a melt to hit the tribs for steelies? Thanks guys.
Hey Wayne...I like today's forecast for Saturday better...  Variable cloudiness and -7C for Innisfil
